skill.name: vibe-security
skill.description: Security intelligence for code analysis. Detects SQL injection, XSS, CSRF, authentication issues, crypto failures, and more. Actions: scan, analyze, fix, audit, check, review, secure, validate, sanitize, protect. Languages: JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, PHP, Java, Go, Ruby. Frameworks: Express, Django, Flask, Laravel, Spring, Rails. Vulnerabilities: SQL injection, XSS, CSRF, authentication bypass, authorization issues, command injection, path traversal, insecure deserialization, weak crypto, sensitive data exposure. Topics: input validation, output encoding, parameterized queries, password hashing, session management, CORS, CSP, security headers, rate limiting, dependency scanning.
skill.summary: Security intelligence for code analysis. Detects SQL injection, XSS, CSRF, authentication issues, cr...
skill.author: 0x8506

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate defensive security scanner skill. All 263 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The detected patterns are vulnerability detection rules (CSV data files), example vulnerable/safe code pairs (fix templates), and analyzer code that detects security issues in user code. No malicious intent, data exfiltration, or unauthorized access patterns found. The skill helps developers identify and fix security vulnerabilities.

content.value_statement: Code vulnerabilities like SQL injection and XSS create serious security risks. This skill automatically detects vulnerabilities across multiple languages and provides secure code fixes with explanations.
actual_capabilities: Detects SQL injection, XSS, command injection, and path traversal vulnerabilities
Analyzes JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, PHP, Java, Go, and Ruby code
Generates secure code fixes with automatic rollback support
Maps vulnerabilities to OWASP Top 10, CWE, and MITRE ATT&CK frameworks
Scans dependencies for known CVE vulnerabilities
Produces HTML, SARIF, CSV, and JSON security reports
limitations: Does not perform dynamic testing or runtime security analysis
Cannot detect business logic vulnerabilities or authentication flaws
Limited to supported languages and frameworks listed in documentation
Does not replace manual security code review for critical systems

use_cases.title: Pre-commit security scanning
use_cases.description: Scan code changes before committing to catch vulnerabilities early in development workflow.

use_cases.title: Automated security audits
use_cases.description: Run comprehensive security scans on codebases and generate compliance reports for audits.

use_cases.title: CI/CD security integration
use_cases.description: Integrate vulnerability scanning into CI/CD pipelines to prevent insecure code reaching production.

prompt_templates.title: Quick security scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Use vibe-security to scan {file_path} for security vulnerabilities and report findings by severity.

prompt_templates.title: Fix SQL injection
prompt_templates.prompt: Use vibe-security to detect SQL injection vulnerabilities in {file_path} and generate secure code fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Full project audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a comprehensive security audit using vibe-security on the entire project including dependency vulnerability scanning. Generate an HTML report.

prompt_templates.title: Compliance mapping
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan {directory} with vibe-security and map all findings to OWASP Top 10 and CWE categories. Provide remediation priorities.

output_examples.input: Scan my Express API for security issues
output: CRITICAL: SQL injection at line 45 - db.query with template literal interpolation
HIGH: XSS vulnerability at line 78 - innerHTML assignment without sanitization
Suggested fixes generated with test templates

output_examples.input: Check Python code for command injection
output: Consider using subprocess.run with array arguments for future code

best_practices: Run security scans before every code deployment or release
Address critical and high severity findings immediately
Use parameterized queries instead of string concatenation for all database operations
anti_patterns: Using innerHTML to display user-generated content without sanitization
Passing user input directly to os.system or exec functions
Storing API keys or passwords directly in source code

faq.question: What languages does vibe-security support?
faq.answer: JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, PHP, Java, Go, Ruby, and infrastructure-as-code formats including Terraform, Kubernetes, Docker, and CloudFormation.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: The autofix feature can apply fixes with backup and rollback support. All changes are logged so you can review or revert them.

faq.question: How accurate are the vulnerability detections?
faq.answer: The AST-based analysis reduces false positives significantly. Pattern-based detection is faster but may require manual verification.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, generate SARIF or JSON reports and use exit codes to fail builds on critical vulnerabilities.

faq.question: What compliance standards are supported?
faq.answer: Vulnerabilities map to OWASP Top 10 2021, CWE Top 25, MITRE ATT&CK, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, and PCI-DSS requirements.

faq.question: Does it scan third-party dependencies?
faq.answer: Yes, the CVE integration scans npm, PyPI, Maven, and other package ecosystems for known vulnerabilities.
